Hi Ron

The svn version is a newer version, I rewrote/restructured a lot of=
 it for various reasons.  The configuration is now all done through one XML=
 file and it now supports HyperNeat (albeit a fairly untested version) that=
 I have tested with some of the experiments various papers (mentioned on th=
is forum) by various authors.  I have further updated it such that it can a=
lso evolve the best activation function for a give node/neuron and fixed a =
few bugs.  However, this version is not in svn on Sourceforge, not had chan=
ce to commit the changes.

The original code is very stable, in fact I thin=
k I only had one real bug raised and was used in various AI competitions.  =
The documentation for the original code is probably not aligned with the sv=
n sourceforge version when you get down to real detail, but the principals =
still hold, and shouldn't take too much effort to work out where the config=
uration elements from the original neat4j have ended up in the new xml conf=
iguration.

Feel free to use either version (don't merge them tho, they are=
 quite different) and if you have any problems let me know.

Cheers

Matt

=

>
> Hi Al=
l,

 of years newer than the zip file one. They are quite a bit different inter=
nally. The docs seem to match the zip file version.
>

referred one? Can or should they be merged? I know
> the project is kind of=
 old, but it looks like it's a stable well-documented code base.

> Regar=
ds,
